title: SAPD: Woman faces murder charge after shooting boyfriend
content:
SAN ANTONIO — A 42-year-old woman faces a charge of murder following a shooting on the South Side Thursday morning.
Officer were called out to a home in the 100 block of West Ansley Boulevard around 12:55 a.m. after receiving reports of the shooting.
When they arrived, officers made contact with a woman who said that she accidentally shot her boyfriend, 27.
Officers went into the residence and a man with a gunshot wound to the torso.
He was pronounced dead at the scene.
The woman, identified by police as Amanda Marie Montoya, was taken into custody for questioning and later arrested on a charge of murder.
Montoya is currently being held at the Bexar County Jail on a $100,000 bond.
